page.title: 09Housing in Sampford Courtney
page.content: As Sampford Courtney is designated a Conservation area,there is relatively little new housing.A few newer houses are found at Sampford Chapple.The main village,mostly cob and thatch,is as it was when built in the Middle Ages. A few of the farms in the centre of the village are now just houses and their outbuildings have been converted into dwellings and sold. Cob,the main building material, consists of well sieved mud mixed with straw and small stones.It was built up in sections 12-18 inches high.It was better preserved when whitewashed as in the old days than the modern cement rendering which cracks and lets in water. New owners have re-thatched old thatch,or corrugated iron which had replaced it.Council grants are now available for this, which must be a great help.
